comments:
Build ID: I20070209-1006

Steps To Reproduce:
1. New/Example/GMF Diagrams/any
2. Next, Finish
3. From diagram's contex menu select Show Properties View
4. Check Error Log View

More information:
I get following error:

I have tracked the bug a bit more down (using Windows). It's a problem in all GMF editors, as the bug stems from the TabbedPropertySheet component. Hence, it might be possible that the bug has to be fixed by the Eclipse Core team. The problem is,  in TabbedPropertyTitle in the method drawTitleBackground. The call to 		Color gbg = factory.getColors().getColor(FormColors.TB_GBG);
returns null and then it causes the exception. Looking into the getColor method you come to the IFormColors where the looked up color is deprecated. Here's the comment in IFormColors:

	 * Key for the section title bar gradient.
	 * @deprecated Since 3.3, this color is not used any more. The 
	 * tool bar gradient is created starting from {@link #TB_BG} to
	 * the section background color.

I successfully extracted the Geoshapes example using 2.0M5uh from the update 
site with no errors in the log.  Can you please verify?
The problem is not to extract the example it happens when running the example and then opening a tabbed property sheet... See my previous comment

The 2.0M5uh version of GMF lists the platform 3.3M5eh as a dependency, which I believe fixed the issue you were seeing (see bug 174442).  I don't see this exception being thrown now, although I am looking into another problem with class loading.
I can confirm that it works with the platform 3.3M5eh build. The bug is closed correctly. Thanks.
